org.drombler.commons.docking.context.impl

Class DockingContextManager<D,DATA extends DockableData,E extends DockableEntry<D,DATA>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drombler.commons.docking.context.impl.DockingContextManager<D,DATA,E>
  • Type Parameters:
    D -
    DATA -
    E -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class DockingContextManager<D,DATA extends DockableData,E extends DockableEntry<D,DATA>>
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    The DockingContextManager registers and unregisters the local Contexts of Dockables depending on the Dockables registered in the specified DockingAreaContainer and sets the active local Context depending on the active Dockable set in the specified DockingAreaContainer. TODO: API ? TODO: good to implement AutoCloseable?
    Author:
    puce
    See Also:
    DockingAreaContainer.getDockables(), DockingAreaContainer.getActiveDockable(), ContextManager.registerLocalContext(java.lang.Object, org.drombler.commons.context.LocalProxyContext), ContextManager.unregisterLocalContext(java.lang.Object), ContextManager.setLocalContextActive(java.lang.Object)
